semantic_title: Child and Adult Abuse External Cause Coding Guidelines
section_path: Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > g. Child and Adult Abuse Guideline

content.full_text: Adult and child abuse, neglect and maltreatment are classified as assault. Any of the assault codes may be used to indicate the external cause of any injury resulting from the confirmed abuse. For confirmed cases of abuse, neglect and maltreatment, when the perpetrator is known, a code from Y07, Perpetrator of maltreatment and neglect, should accompany any other assault codes. (Evidence: pg no: 90, L82-L83)
content.summary: Abuse, neglect, and maltreatment are classified as assault, using assault codes for external cause, with Y07 perpetrator codes when perpetrator is known in confirmed cases (Evidence: pg no: 90, L82-L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Adult and child abuse, neglect and maltreatment are classified as assault (Evidence: pg no: 90, L82)
detailed_rules.explanation: All forms of abuse, neglect, and maltreatment, whether involving adults or children, are coded using assault external cause codes (Evidence: pg no: 90, L82)
detailed_rules.applies_to: All abuse, neglect, and maltreatment cases

detailed_rules.rule_text: Any assault codes may be used for injuries from confirmed abuse (Evidence: pg no: 90, L82-L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: The full range of assault external cause codes is available for coding injuries that result from confirmed cases of abuse, neglect, or maltreatment (Evidence: pg no: 90, L82-L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Y07 perpetrator codes should accompany assault codes when perpetrator is known in confirmed cases (Evidence: pg no: 90, L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: For confirmed cases of abuse, neglect, or maltreatment where the perpetrator is identified, a Y07 code specifying the perpetrator relationship should be assigned along with the assault external cause code (Evidence: pg no: 90, L83)
detailed_rules.applies_to: Confirmed abuse cases with known perpetrators

workflow_steps: Step 1: Confirm the case involves abuse, neglect, or maltreatment
Step 2: Code the injury or condition as primary diagnosis
Step 3: Assign appropriate assault external cause code
Step 4: If perpetrator is known, assign Y07 perpetrator code
Step 5: Sequence according to external cause hierarchy (abuse has highest priority)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Child presents with confirmed physical abuse injuries from parent
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 5-year-old child with multiple bruises and fractures, confirmed physical abuse by father
step_by_step: Step 1: Code the injuries (bruises, fractures) as primary diagnoses
Step 2: Assign assault external cause code for the injuries
Step 3: Assign Y07.11 (biological father) as perpetrator code
Step 4: Sequence abuse codes first due to highest priority

step_by_step: Step 1: Code the injuries as primary diagnoses

Step 4: Follow standard external cause sequencing
